title: Indicator vector
summary: In mathematics, the indicator vector or characteristic vector or incidence vector of a subset T of a set S is the vector x T := ( x s ) s ∈ S {\displaystyle x_{T}:=(x_{s})_{s\in S}} such that x s = 1 {\displaystyle x_{s}=1} if s ∈ T {\displaystyle s\in T} and x s = 0 {\displaystyle x_{s}=0} if s ∉ T . {\displaystyle s\notin T.}
